definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: A bean in liberty is better than a comfit in prison.
sentences.chinese: 闲散的豆子总比监禁的糖果要强。

sentences.english: Students complained that his casual manner was not befitting of a haiku master.
sentences.chinese: 学生抱怨他的闲散方式和俳谐师身份不相称。

sentences.english: On grey mornings of rain I have crooned many an idle song.
sentences.chinese: 在细雨霏霏的清晨，我吟唱过许多闲散的歌谣。

sentences.english: Such idle institutions should have been stopped, or merged with other institutions.
sentences.chinese: 这样闲散的机构，早就应该被撤并了。

sentences.english: Is being idle in the chaos of war?
sentences.chinese: 是于兵荒马乱中的闲散自淫？

sentences.english: Time will tell whether my early ramblings were half as profound as I’d hoped they were.
sentences.chinese: 时间将告诉我早期的闲散和我所希望的深刻是否相等。

sentences.english: Spare moments are the gold-dust of time.
sentences.chinese: 闲散的时刻是时间的金沙。

sentences.english: This firm can't afford (to carry) passengers .
sentences.chinese: 这家商行养不起闲散人员。

sentences.english: On many an idle day have I grieved over lost time.
sentences.chinese: 在许多闲散的日子，我悼惜着虚度了的光阴。

sentences.english: When they are idle they indulgethemselves into comfort lechery crapulence and gluttony .
sentences.chinese: 他们闲散时就沉溺于安乐纵欲暴饮暴食。

sentences.english: No more the drudge and idler—ten that toil where one reposes.
sentences.chinese: 不再有人必须在闲散富人休息的时候十倍辛勤工作。

sentences.english: In the late Tang Dynasty, Sinongsi basically became an idle organization.
sentences.chinese: 唐代后期，司农寺基本上成为闲散机构。

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
variant of 閒人|闲人[xian2 ren2]/idle person/idler/unconcerned person
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
